summary: This is an email chain between attorneys at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP discussing a court transcript from a proceeding related to Jeffrey Epstein's estate. The emails focus on the identification of Mark Epstein as the sole beneficiary of the estate and the receipt of a draft protocol from a mediator (Feinberg).

persons.name: Alex Conlon
persons.role: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP
persons.context: Sends and forwards the court transcript, coordinates communication about the Epstein estate proceedings.

persons.name: Kate L. Doniger
persons.role: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP
persons.context: Receives and sends documents related to the estate, including a draft protocol from Feinberg and filings from the US Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Roberta Kaplan
persons.role: Attorney at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP (referred to as 'Robbie')
persons.context: Key attorney discussing the estate proceedings; mentions that Mark Epstein is the beneficiary and comments on the draft protocol.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.role: Brother and beneficiary of Jeffrey Epstein's estate
persons.context: Identified in the court transcript and email discussion as the sole beneficiary of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Bennet Moskowitz
persons.role: Individual who made a statement in court
persons.context: Mentioned by Roberta Kaplan as having stated at an earlier conference that Mark Epstein is the beneficiary.

persons.name: Judge Freeman
persons.context: Presided over an earlier conference in the Epstein estate proceedings.

persons.name: Judge Failla
persons.context: Presided over a conference where the value of claims and the estate beneficiary were discussed.

persons.name: Feinberg
persons.context: Sent a draft protocol related to the Epstein estate claims, which the attorneys criticize.

connections.description: Kaplan is an attorney involved in proceedings concerning the estate of which Mark Epstein is the beneficiary.
Both are attorneys at Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP collaborating on the Epstein estate case.
Both are attorneys at the same firm, with Conlon assisting Kaplan with transcripts and communications.
Mark Epstein is identified as the brother and sole beneficiary of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.
Moskowitz is reported to have stated in court that Mark Epstein is the beneficiary of the estate.

events.title: Court Conference before Judge Freeman
events.description: First appearance in front of Judge Freeman in proceedings related to Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

events.title: Court Conference before Judge Failla
events.description: A conference where Judge Failla discussed the potential value of claims and the estate beneficiary.

events.title: Receipt of Draft Protocol and USVI Filings
events.description: The estate's attorneys received a draft protocol from mediator Feinberg and filings from the Epstein estate in the US Virgin Islands.

keyFacts: Mark Epstein is identified as the sole beneficiary of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, as stated in court and confirmed by attorneys.
Attorneys from Kaplan Hecker & Fink LLP are actively involved in legal proceedings concerning the distribution of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.
A draft protocol from mediator Feinberg regarding estate claims was received and criticized by the attorneys.
The estate filed documents in the US Virgin Islands, indicating legal activity in that jurisdiction.
Judge Failla acknowledged the potential for claims worth 'millions upon millions of dollars' against the estate, even excluding punitive damages.
